metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45412 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When resolving a symlink such as file:///proc/self/fd/1, an error message may be produced where the symlink was resolved to a string containing unitialized memory in the buffer.
*This bug only affects Thunderbird on Unix-based operated systems (Android, Linux, MacOS). Windows is unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap
